item.title: [webgl2] Issue with "WebGL2RenderingContext.getBufferSubData()": Argument 3 does not implement interface ArrayBufferView
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/getBufferSubData

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The dstData argument of type ArrayBuffer doesn't work and results in this error:

Uncaught TypeError: WebGL2RenderingContext.getBufferSubData: Argument 3 does not implement interface ArrayBufferView.

Specific section or headline?

Parameters and Examples

What did you expect to see?

Data from the buffer

Did you test this? If so, how?

Example code:

let canvas = document.createElement("canvas");
let gl = canvas.getContext("webgl2");
let position_buffer = gl.createBuffer();
gl.bindBuffer(gl.ARRAY_BUFFER, position_buffer);
let positions = [
    -1.0, 1.0, 0.0,
    1.0, 1.0, 0.0,
    -1.0, -1.0, 0.0,
    1.0, -1.0, 0.0,
    1.0, 1.0, 0.0,
    -1.0, -1.0, 0.0
];
gl.bufferData(gl.ARRAY_BUFFER, new Float32Array(positions), gl.STATIC_DRAW);

let arrBuffer = new ArrayBuffer(positions.length * Float32Array.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT);
gl.getBufferSubData(gl.ARRAY_BUFFER, 0, arrBuffer);

item.title: [webgl2] Issue with "WebGL2RenderingContext.getBufferSubData()": Example is not working.
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL2RenderingContext/getBufferSubData

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The Examples section is wrong, this is not how this method is used.

Specific section or headline?

This example will throw because dstData must be an ArrayBufferView, it can't be a bare ArrayBuffer.
But even though I'm not an expert myself in the subject matter, it seems the whole example isn't a good example of how this method should be used.

What did you expect to see?

A real good example of how and when to use this method. It seems https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL_API/WebGL_best_practices#non-blocking_async_data_downloadreadback has a better (at least working) example, but maybe it does more than required? I can't really judge that.

Did you test this? If so, how?

I read the specs and tested in both Firefox and Chrome.

item.title: [webgl1, webgl2] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext/bindFramebuffer
item.content:encoded:
Request type

  • Please close this issue, I accidentally submitted it without adding any details
  • New documentation
  • Correction or update

Details

The documentation page for gl.bindFramebuffer (here) does not make it clear that in order to bind the default framebuffer (to render to the screen), you would do gl.bindFramebuffer(gl.FRAMEBUFFER, null). This is an important use case of this function, and it should be documented.
